definition: to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]

sentences.english: We are busy preparing the land for sowing.
sentences.chinese: 我们忙于平整土地，准备播种。

sentences.english: He busied himself by tidying up his desk.
She was busy (in) learning computer then.
sentences.chinese: 她那时正在忙于学电脑。

sentences.english: Other companies are busy with further research and development of drugs targeting CCR5.
sentences.chinese: 其他公司则忙于研发更进一步的靶向CCR5的药品。

sentences.english: Being busily engaged in study, Professor Smith sported his door.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯教授忙于钻研学问，他闭门谢客。

sentences.english: In addition many early nudists practiced vegetarianism and engaged in daily exercise.
sentences.chinese: 此外许多早期裸癖者奉行素食主义并忙于日常运动。

sentences.english: The Chinese players are busy getting ready for the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 我国体育健儿正忙于备战2008年北京奥运会。

sentences.english: American lawmakers and law enforcers are busy with the housing finance market.
sentences.chinese: 美国立法机构和司法机构正忙于住房金融市场。

sentences.english: The class are busying writing English passages.
sentences.chinese: 班上同学在忙于写英语短文。

sentences.english: I do very little to help others. I am busy caring for a family and working full time.
sentences.chinese: 平时我很少帮助别人，整日忙于工作和照顾家庭。

sentences.english: The months went by quickly while I busied myself with preparation for the move.
sentences.chinese: 之后，我整天忙于搬家的事，几个月飞快地过去了。

sentences.english: Robert Daffin stays busy prying open the shellfish to serve customers.
sentences.chinese: 达夫因一直忙于为顾客剖开牡蛎的服务。

sentences.english: G. Montgomerie, was quietly busy in surveying the mountains of Kashmir.
sentences.chinese: 蒙特哥摩利正悄悄忙于勘察克什米尔境内的山峰。

sentences.english: Today, dad and every family members were very busy preparing for setting off for fishing.
sentences.chinese: 今天，爸爸和家人都忙于准备出海捕鱼。

sentences.english: But for most of the time this gentleman was busy with his packages of snack and kua chi.
sentences.chinese: 但大部分时间这个绅士都忙于消灭他的那一袋小吃。

definition: to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
to fail to pay sufficient attention to/to be negligent in regard to/to be lacking in
lit. badly burned about the head (from trying to put out a fire) (idiom)/fig. hard-pressed/under pressure (from a heavy workload, creditors etc)
(idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work
too busy/to have no time for/fully occupied
to set one's heart on sth (idiom)
to have more work than one can deal with/to have one's hands full
to concentrate entirely on sth/fully engaged/with full force
to immerse oneself in/engrossed in sth/to lower the head (e.g. to avoid rain)/countersunk (of screws, rivets etc)
